q1.question: How secure is my data?
q1.answer: We use bank-level 256-bit encryption for all data in transit and at rest. Our infrastructure is SOC 2 Type II certified and we undergo regular third-party security audits. Your data is backed up daily and stored in geographically distributed data centers.

q2.question: Can I migrate from my current system?
q2.answer: Yes! We offer free data migration assistance for all new customers. Our team will work with you to import your existing cases, contacts, and documents from most major practice management systems.

q3.question: Is there a free trial?
q3.answer: Absolutely! We offer a 14-day free trial with full access to all features. No credit card required. You can upgrade, downgrade, or cancel at any time.

q4.question: What kind of support do you offer?
q4.answer: All plans include email support with response times under 24 hours. Professional and Enterprise plans get priority support with faster response times. Enterprise customers also receive a dedicated account manager and 24/7 phone support.

q5.question: Can I customize workflows?
q5.answer: Yes! Our workflow builder allows you to create custom automation tailored to your practice. Professional and Enterprise plans include advanced workflow features and custom integrations with your existing tools.

privacy.title: Data Processing Policy
privacy.intro: LexLegal Cloud respects the personal data and information provided by its current, past, and potential clients. This Personal Data Protection Policy establishes the purposes, measures, and procedures for our databases, as well as the mechanisms available to data holders to know, update, rectify, delete provided data, or revoke the authorization granted with the acceptance of this policy, in accordance with Statutory Law 1581 of 2012 and Decree 1377 of 2013.
privacy.section1_content: LexLegal Cloud, as the entity responsible for processing personal data, informs that collected data will be processed legally, lawfully, confidentially, and securely.
privacy.section2_content: The processing of personal data has the following purposes: a) To carry out relevant management for the development of the company's social object. b) To send invitations to events, manage processes (requests, complaints, claims). c) To manage the contractual relationship with the client. d) Billing and accounting management. e) To conduct satisfaction surveys.
privacy.section3_content: As the holder of your personal data, you have the right to: (i) Access your data free of charge. (ii) Know, update, and rectify your information regarding partial, inaccurate, incomplete, fractionated, misleading data, or data whose processing is prohibited. (iii) Request proof of the authorization granted. (iv) File complaints with the Superintendence of Industry and Commerce (SIC). (v) Revoke authorization and/or request data deletion.
privacy.section4_content: The processing of personal data carried out by the company requires the free, prior, express, and informed consent of the data holder. By accepting this policy, you state that the data provided is truthful and that you have the authority to authorize its processing.
privacy.section5_content: We have implemented the necessary technical, administrative, and human security measures to protect your information and prevent its adulteration, loss, lateral consultation, use, or unauthorized or fraudulent access, complying with the standards required by the Superintendence of Industry and Commerce.
privacy.section6_content: To exercise your rights as a data holder, you can contact us at any time at the email address:
privacy.section7_content: You can exercise your rights to Access, Rectify, Cancel, and Oppose the processing of your data directly through your account settings. Go to 'Profile Settings > Privacy & Data' to manage your information or submit an ARCO request.

cookies.title: Cookie Policy
cookies.intro: This Cookie Policy explains what cookies are and how we use them.
cookies.section1_content: Cookies are small text files that are sent to your web browser by a website you visit. A cookie file is stored in your web browser and allows the Service or a third-party to recognize you and make your next visit easier and the Service more useful to you.
cookies.section2_content: When you use and access the Service, we may place a number of cookies files in your web browser. We use cookies for the following purposes: to enable certain functions of the Service, to provide analytics, to store your preferences, to enable advertisements delivery, including behavioral advertising.
cookies.section3_content: We use essential cookies to authenticate users and prevent fraudulent use of user accounts.
cookies.section4_content: We use analytics cookies to track information about how the Service is used so we can make improvements. We may also use analytics cookies to test new features or pages.
cookies.section5_content: You can control and/or delete cookies as you wish. You can delete all cookies that are already on your computer and you can set most browsers to prevent them from being placed. If you do this, however, you may have to manually adjust some preferences every time you visit a site and some services and functionalities may not work.
